programme.title: Triuir aig Tri

programme.title: Treubh an Tuathanais (Big Barn Farm)

programme.desc: Friday Nights Are A Bad Cocktail: The drug squad makes a pre-dawn arrest on a worker travelling over the border from Spain on his moped, and trainee officers undergo pepper spray training.

programme.title: Cops on the Rock
programme.desc: Brace, Brace, Brace: Customs officers spring into action after news of a sinking boat - on land, Sergeant Steve uses good old-fashioned legwork to track down two stolen scooters.

programme.title: How Britain Worked
programme.desc: Guy Martin helps with the restoration of the oldest surviving Brixham sailing trawler and discovers how Britain acquired its taste for fish and chips.

programme.title: How Britain Worked
programme.desc: Guy Martin helps with the restoration of Birmingham Botanical Gardens while learning how to blow glass and trying to rebuild one of the first lawnmowers.

programme.title: Border Force America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A woman is caught trying to enter the US with a baby that isn't hers, a man wanted for a serious crime is intercepted, and a driver has a heart attack while crossing a bridge.

programme.title: Border Force America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Methamphetamine is found in a shipment of broccoli, an elderly man tries to smuggle pills in protein powder, and a woman receives a humanitarian visa to see her dying son.

programme.title: Cape Carnage: Killer Catch
programme.desc: Making Big Money: The crew of the Wildcard push hard to hit their season's 35-tonne break-even target, and a return to Cape Carnage results in a season-ending injury for one of the team.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Actor and Top Gear test track inspiration Sir Michael Gambon joins the boys for a driver's cars edition that includes Lada, Lotus, a white van man and a Maserati.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: More motoring mayhem and reviews, this time including a look at the Subaru Forester, the Cool Wall, Insider Dealing and a review of the Golf R32.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Takeaways: The biker duo explore how Britain's love affair with takeaway food has evolved and cook some of their favourites in the Best of British kitchen.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: Malaysia 2 and Sri Lanka: Adventures in far eastern cuisine. Rick Stein explores the multifaceted food of Penang, and in Sri Lanka he visits a bustling fishing village.

programme.title: Would I Lie To You?
programme.desc: Christmas Special: The jolly panel show goes all Christmassy as Miranda Hart, Stephen Mangan, Barry Cryer and Miles Jupp join the three wise regulars.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Comedians Babatunde Aleshe and Jo Caulfield, radio presenter Richie Anderson, and the legendary Carol Smillie enter Richard's den of quiz for this edition.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Comedians Milton Jones and Ria Lina, popular property expert Martin Roberts, and TV presenter Briony May Williams join the host for a fiendish test of their general knowledge.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Jingle Bells: Christmas Special: Jolly old Stephen Fry jingles a few bells with Sarah Millican, Phill Jupitus, Danny Baker and Alan Davies in a special festive edition of the quiz show.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Alex Horne is host as comedian Jack Dee and broadcaster Carol Vorderman join team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to delve into the news.

programme.desc: The Big Bran Hypothesis: Sheldon sneaks into Penny's flat to tidy it. She's not happy about it.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: All eyes are on Lucas as his desperate bid to win back Dillon begins to spiral out of control. Frankie confides in Dodger, but will his concern make her question her new beau?

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: The walls close in on Mercedes as she races to get the money for her blackmailer. And Dillon and Rex try to support Ste as he struggles with his emotions.

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Bad Fish Paradigm: Penny opens up to a reluctant Sheldon after a less-than-stellar first date with Leonard, putting him in the awkward position of having to keep a secret.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Codpiece Topology: Seeing Penny out on a date with another guy sends a distressed Leonard rushing back to Leslie Winkle, much to Sheldon's dismay.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Barbarian Sublimation: Penny becomes addicted to an online game based on the world of Conan the Barbarian and begins to pester Sheldon for advice.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Griffin Equivalency: Full of confidence after being named one of People magazine's '30 to Watch Under 30', Raj hits on Penny and becomes impossibly arrogant.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Euclid Alternative: When Leonard can't drive Sheldon to and from work, the friends stage an intervention to overcome Sheldon's fear of getting behind the wheel.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Cooper-Nowitzki Theorem: Sheldon's friends are mystified when a younger student is attracted to him, and her intense devotion soon becomes too much to bear.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Panty Piata Polarization: Sheldon bans Penny from the flat for numerous minor infractions, so she retaliates. Howard and Raj search for the America's Next Top Model house.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Lizard-Spock Expansion: Howard is furious when a woman who he likes falls for Leonard, despite Howard's efforts to woo her.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The White Asparagus Triangulation: Sheldon is delighted that Leonard has finally found a girlfriend who matches up to his high standards... Perhaps a little too delighted.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Vartabedian Conundrum: Leonard goes to Penny for help when his relationship with Stephanie takes off faster than he'd like, but will he act on her advice?

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Bath Item Gift Hypothesis: At Christmas, Leonard's hunky colleague starts dating Penny, while Sheldon's obsession with gift-giving etiquette torments everyone.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Killer Robot Instability: Kripke challenges the boys to a robot duel, while Howard is devastated when Penny finally tells him what she thinks of his chauvinism.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Friendship Algorithm: Sheldon develops a scientific procedure for making friends when he discovers that Kripke has control of a new supercomputer at the university.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Financial Permeability: When Sheldon lends Penny some money, it brings her ex-boyfriend Kurt back into her life, with negative consequences for the gang.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Maternal Capacitance: A disastrous visit from Leonard's mother has the unexpected side-effect of bringing Leonard and Penny closer together.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Dead Hooker Juxtaposition: Penny develops a rivalry with a sexy female neighbour who moves into the apartment building and threatens to become the 'new Penny'.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: News
programme.desc: The leading news stories of the moment.

programme.title: Hunter Killer
programme.desc: (2018) Nautical action thriller. Gerard Butler stars as an unconventional submarine skipper sent to investigate the torpedoing of a US vessel. With Gary Oldman, Linda Cardellini and Common.

programme.title: Minari
programme.desc: (2020) Moving drama. In the 1980s, the Yi family move to rural Arkansas to live the American Dream. But the reality is harsh and the family are soon struggling to survive. In Korean/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: LumoTV: You, Me
programme.desc: Drama. A charming family story of how a young deaf girl learns that Santa is not deaf.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Young Winston
programme.desc: (1972) Biopic charting the rise of the future PM from battered Harrow pupil to MP via military action on foreign soil. Directed by Richard Attenborough.

programme.title: Two Way Stretch
programme.desc: (1960) Comedy. Peter Sellers, Bernard Cribbins and David Lodge star as criminals happily incarcerated in a prison run like a home-from-home for old lags and rascals by a liberal governor.

programme.title: Far from the Madding Crowd
programme.desc: (1967) Julie Christie and Terence Stamp star in John Schlesinger's adaptation of Thomas Hardy's novel. Bathsheba is not short of suitors, but will marrying any of them lead to happiness?

programme.title: Dante's Peak
programme.desc: (1997) Action thriller starring Pierce Brosnan and Linda Hamilton. The inhabitants of a volcano-side resort unwisely ignore a scientist's warning about its imminent eruption.

programme.title: The Menu
programme.desc: (2022) Horror with Ralph Fiennes and Anya Taylor-Joy. Only one diner at an exclusive eatery sees through the foam quenelles to the pile of steaming prairie oysters beyond. Mayhem ensues.

programme.title: Everything Everywhere All at Once
programme.desc: (2022) Darkly comic sci-fi action thriller with Michelle Yeoh. A laundromat owner's drab existence becomes much more exciting when she must traverse the multiverse to defeat an evil force.

programme.title: Your Name.
programme.desc: (2016) Exquisitely romantic anime. A city boy falls for a country girl when they swap bodies. But after the connection is broken, he sets out to find his love. In Japanese/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: A Kid for Two Farthings
programme.desc: (1955) Carol Reed's charming film stars Jonathan Ashmore as a young, impressionable boy who mistakes a one-horned goat for a unicorn in London's colourful Petticoat Lane market.

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: (1954) Western starring Dana Andrews. A man falsely accused of murder gets a last-minute reprieve from the lynch mob so he can track down the real culprit.

programme.title: Mysterious Island
programme.desc: (1961) Sci-fi adventure based on Jules Verne's novel. Two men fleeing the US Civil War find an island inhabited by monsters (animated by Ray Harryhausen) and the mysterious Captain Nemo.

programme.title: Oblivion Interview Special
programme.desc: Tom Cruise talks about making the sci-fi-adventure Oblivion.

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army
programme.desc: (1961) World War II comedy starring Jack Lemmon. A luckless naval lieutenant is duped into commanding a dangerous mission into enemy territory during the Battle of the Bismarck Sea.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout...
programme.desc: ...Interview Special: Tom Cruise, Rebecca Ferguson, Henry Cavill, Simon Pegg, Vanessa Kirby and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about making the sixth instalment in the thriller series.

programme.title: Fisherman's Friends
programme.desc: (2019) Heart-warming comedy based on the real-life story of the Cornish folk ensemble who took the UK charts by storm in 2010, starring Daniel Mays and Tuppence Middleton.

programme.title: The Unbearable Weight of...
programme.desc: ...Massive Talent: (2022) Nicolas Cage stars as, er, Nic Cage - an unbearably talented actor caught up in a CIA investigation while trying to resurrect his ailing career. With Pedro Pascal.

programme.title: The Quiet Girl
programme.desc: (2022) Colm Bairad's poignant drama about a little girl who's sent away from home to live with distant family in rural Ireland. Based on Claire Keegan's novella Foster. In Gaelic/subs.

programme.title: Spencer
programme.desc: (2021) Kristen Stewart dons the famous pixie cut to play an embattled Princess Diana in director Pablo Larran's stylised dramatisation of three stifling Christmas nights at Sandringham.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Payroll
programme.desc: (1961) British crime thriller starring Billie Whitelaw. When Jackie's husband - an armoured van driver - is killed in a heist, she vows to unmask those responsible and take her revenge.

programme.title: A Lawless Street
programme.desc: (1955) A non-stop romp of a western from director Joseph H Lewis. In the town of Medicine Bend, only Marshal Calem Ware can keep its citizens from falling into complete lawlessness.

programme.title: Oblivion Interview Special
programme.desc: Tom Cruise talks about making the sci-fi-adventure Oblivion.

programme.title: The Colditz Story
programme.desc: (1954) Classic Second World War drama. John Mills, Lionel Jeffries and Bryan Forbes star as just some of the POWs determined to break out of the infamous German 'escape-proof' prison.

programme.title: Jingle All the Way
programme.desc: (1996) Brian Levant's festive all-action comedy. Arnold Schwarzenegger is on a mission to get his son (Jake Lloyd) the must-have Christmas toy, Turbo Man. But it's sold out everywhere...

programme.title: The Day After Tomorrow
programme.desc: (2004) Tense sci-fi thriller starring Jake Gyllenhaal and Dennis Quaid. A scientist sets out to save his son when global warming plunges the world into a sudden climatic catastrophe.

programme.title: Wrath of Man
programme.desc: (2021) Jason Statham reunites with director Guy Ritchie to give it both barrels as a mysterious hardman working for a money truck firm that keeps getting hit. But is he an inside man?

programme.title: The Mechanic
programme.desc: (2011) Thriller with Jason Statham and Donald Sutherland. A hitman is ordered to kill his mentor, but then takes on the dead man's son as an apprentice. Could get complicated... and deadly.

programme.title: Good Luck to You, Leo Grande
programme.desc: (2022) Drama starring Emma Thompson as a recently widowed, retired teacher who has a sexual bucket list she wants to get around to now that she has the time and, perhaps, even the energy.

programme.title: Hunter Killer
programme.desc: (2018) Nautical action thriller. Gerard Butler stars as an unconventional submarine skipper sent to investigate the torpedoing of a US vessel. With Gary Oldman, Linda Cardellini and Common.

programme.title: Minari
programme.desc: (2020) Moving drama. In the 1980s, the Yi family move to rural Arkansas to live the American Dream. But the reality is harsh and the family are soon struggling to survive. In Korean/subs.

programme.desc: (1954) Classic Second World War drama. John Mills, Lionel Jeffries and Bryan Forbes star as just some of the POWs determined to break out of the infamous German 'escape-proof' prison.

programme.title: Jingle All the Way
programme.desc: (1996) Brian Levant's festive all-action comedy. Arnold Schwarzenegger is on a mission to get his son (Jake Lloyd) the must-have Christmas toy, Turbo Man. But it's sold out everywhere...

programme.title: The Day After Tomorrow
programme.desc: (2004) Tense sci-fi thriller starring Jake Gyllenhaal and Dennis Quaid. A scientist sets out to save his son when global warming plunges the world into a sudden climatic catastrophe.

programme.title: Wrath of Man
programme.desc: (2021) Jason Statham reunites with director Guy Ritchie to give it both barrels as a mysterious hardman working for a money truck firm that keeps getting hit. But is he an inside man?

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: A woman has an operation to repair the hernia she suffered while giving birth and a four-year-old's ear blockage is so bad he needs a general anaesthetic to it sucked out.

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: More birth stories from the maternity ward at Liverpool Women's Hospital. A mum takes her son's place to welcome a grandchild she has only just found out about.

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: V and Ollie blue light to a rugby pitch to help a man who had a seizure. Plus, Stef and Lee treat an excitable 6-year-old Spider-Man fighting an asthma attack.

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Extreme Love Autism
programme.desc: Louis Theroux explores relationships complicated by medical conditions. Here, he visits one of America's best schools for autism.

programme.title: The Wheel
programme.desc: Joey Essex, Rosie Jones, Will Kirk, Angela Rippon, Jonathan Ross, Ranvir Singh and DanTDM take on a colossal spinning wheel in an attempt to help contestants win a cash prize.

programme.title: Teleshopping
